skill.name: chapter-outline-generator
skill.description: Generates detailed chapter outlines for books, including key scenes, plot progression, character arcs, and themes. Use this when planning book structure or expanding story ideas.
skill.summary: Creates structured chapter outlines with plot progression and character development.
skill.author: Amraha-Anwar

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation with instructions for generating chapter outlines. All static analysis findings are false positives from pattern matching on benign text. No code execution, network requests, or filesystem operations present.

content.user_title: Generate Structured Chapter Outlines for Your Book
content.value_statement: Planning a book requires clear structure and narrative flow. This skill generates comprehensive chapter outlines with key scenes, plot progression, character development, and thematic elements to streamline your writing process.
actual_capabilities: Generate detailed chapter outlines based on book title, genre, and plot summary
Structure outlines according to standard narrative arcs including setup, rising action, climax, and resolution
Include key events, character development moments, emotional tone, and themes for each chapter
Create logical transitions and cliffhangers between chapters
Ensure continuity and consistency across the entire book structure
limitations: Does not write full chapter content, only outlines and structural elements
Requires user input for book details such as title, genre, plot summary, and chapter count
Cannot guarantee creative originality or evaluate literary quality of generated outlines

use_cases.title: Fiction Authors Planning Novel Structure
use_cases.description: Authors can input their story concept and receive a complete chapter-by-chapter outline that maps plot progression, character arcs, and thematic development throughout their book.

use_cases.title: Writing Coaches Developing Course Materials
use_cases.description: Writing instructors can generate example chapter outlines to demonstrate narrative structure principles and teach students how to organize their stories effectively.

use_cases.title: Content Creators Planning Series Narratives
use_cases.description: Writers creating episodic content can use this skill to structure serialized stories with proper pacing, hooks, and narrative momentum across multiple installments.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Chapter Outline Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a chapter outline for a fantasy novel titled The Lost Kingdom with 15 chapters. The plot follows a young princess who must reclaim her throne from an evil sorcerer.
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner writers needing a complete outline from basic story details

prompt_templates.title: Genre-Specific Outline with Themes
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 20-chapter outline for a mystery thriller called Silent Witness. Focus on suspense pacing and include red herrings in chapters 5, 10, and 15. The theme is justice versus revenge.
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate writers who understand genre conventions and want thematic depth

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Multi-Arc Outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a 25-chapter outline for a science fiction epic with three parallel character arcs that converge at chapter 18. Include subplot integration and world-building moments in each chapter.
prompt_templates.scenario: Advanced writers managing complex narratives with multiple storylines

prompt_templates.title: Revision and Structure Refinement
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a rough outline for my romance novel but the pacing feels off. Here is my current 12-chapter structure. Revise it to improve emotional beats and ensure proper tension escalation.
prompt_templates.scenario: Experienced writers refining existing outlines for better narrative flow

output_examples.input: Generate a 3-chapter outline for a short mystery story about a missing heirloom necklace at a family reunion.
output_examples.output:
Chapter 1: The Gathering Storm
- Family arrives at grandmother's estate for reunion
- Necklace discovered missing during dinner
- Tension rises as family members suspect each other
- Tone: Suspenseful, intimate
- Cliffhanger: Protagonist finds a cryptic note in the jewelry box

Chapter 2: Secrets Unveiled
- Protagonist interviews family members, uncovering old grudges
- Flashback reveals the necklace's sentimental history
- Red herring: Cousin seen near the bedroom earlier
- Tone: Investigative, emotionally charged
- Cliffhanger: Protagonist discovers the necklace was never stolen

Chapter 3: The Truth Behind the Lie
- Grandmother admits hiding the necklace to bring family together
- Family confronts their unresolved conflicts
- Necklace gifted to protagonist as symbol of healing
- Tone: Reflective, warm
- Resolution: Family bonds strengthened through shared experience

output_examples.input: Create an outline for chapters 8-10 of a fantasy adventure where the hero reaches the dragon's lair.
output_examples.output:
Chapter 8: The Mountain's Shadow
- Hero and companions reach the base of Dragon Peak
- Local villagers share warnings and ancient legends
- Character moment: Hero doubts their readiness for the confrontation
- Themes: Courage, destiny
- Transition: Team begins dangerous ascent at dawn

Chapter 9: Trials of the Ascent
- Physical and magical obstacles test each companion's strengths
- Subplot: Tension between wizard and rogue comes to a head
- Discovery: Ancient carvings hint at dragon's true nature
- Themes: Unity, sacrifice
- Cliffhanger: Cave entrance appears, but ground trembles ominously

Chapter 10: The Dragon's Challenge
- Face-to-face encounter with the dragon in its cavern
- Dragon speaks in riddles, testing hero's wisdom not just strength
- Revelation: Dragon is guardian, not villain
- Themes: Perspective, wisdom over violence
- Transition: Dragon offers alliance against true threat

best_practices: Provide clear book details including title, genre, target word count, and main plot summary for more tailored outlines
Specify the number of chapters based on your genre conventions and desired story length
Review and customize generated outlines to match your unique voice and creative vision
anti_patterns: Treating generated outlines as rigid templates that cannot be modified during actual writing
Requesting outlines without having a clear understanding of your core story concept and themes
Expecting the skill to generate full chapter content rather than structural outlines and key points

faq.question: What information do I need to provide to generate a chapter outline?
faq.answer: You need to provide the book title, genre, main plot summary, and desired number of chapters. Additional details like character descriptions, themes, and tone preferences will produce more tailored outlines.

faq.question: Can this skill write full chapters or just outlines?
faq.answer: This skill generates structural outlines with key scenes, plot points, and thematic elements. It does not write full narrative prose or complete chapter content.

faq.question: How does the skill ensure continuity across chapters?
faq.answer: The skill follows standard narrative arc principles and tracks plot progression, character development, and thematic consistency throughout the outline sequence to maintain logical flow.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-fiction books?
faq.answer: While this skill is designed for narrative fiction with plot-driven structures, it can be adapted for narrative non-fiction that follows storytelling conventions. Pure instructional or reference books may not fit well.

faq.question: What genres work best with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with all narrative fiction genres including fantasy, mystery, thriller, romance, science fiction, and literary fiction. It adapts to genre-specific conventions when provided with genre information.

faq.question: Can I modify the outline after it is generated?
faq.answer: Yes, the generated outline is a starting point and should be customized to fit your creative vision, writing style, and specific story needs. Treat it as a flexible framework not a rigid template.
